Specifically, in our model each infected individual i gets assigned a transmissibility rate λ
i by randomly drawing the rate from a Gamma distribution with mean μ λ and standard deviation σ λ. The gamma distribution is a common choice when modeling individual heterogeneity for a parameter. While infectious, this individual infects new individuals randomly in time, with rate λ
i per unit of time. Also we assume that the transmission rates of the infector and the infectee in a transmission event are independent. Later we will evaluate our model under the condition with autocorrelation of transmission rates.
